goal.en: "First, the teaching objectives: Through the use of IT tools to improve the quality of government services and the public participation, innovation has become an indispensable element of government services. The extent of the government's reliance on this tool from the 1999 mayor's hotline, public mail, various actions to youtube app application to communicate as a policy platform, it can be seen clearly, both deep and wide, behind the more involved government efficiency, transparency of information, public participation, deliberative democracy, and even personal privacy issues. This course is the intention of introducing e-government applications, understand the issues involved in behind it, reflect the government's role and responsibilities."
goal.ch: "一、教學目標： 透過運用資訊科技工具，提升政府服務品質及民眾參與程度，已成為當前政府服務創新不可或缺的要素。從1999市長熱線、民意信箱、各種行動app的應用到以youtube作為政策溝通平台，明顯可看出政府倚重此一工具的程度，既深且廣，其背後更涉及政府效能、資訊公開透明、公眾參與、審議民主，甚至是個人隱私保護議題。本課程意圖引介各項電子化政府的應用，瞭解其背後所涉及的各項議題，反思政府的角色與責任。"

content.en:
"Week schedule and course content
1. The trend of electronic government services (a): Global Trends
2. The Government Electronic Service Delivery Trends (two): e-government
3. The Government Electronic Services Delivery Trends (three): e-governance
4. Service Innovation: Smart City (smart city) to promote
5. Cloud Application Services (app) Government Efficiency
6. Open data (open data): Information disclosure and expose
7. huge amount of data (big data): administrative data mining
8. Performance Information and Government Performance Management
9. Information and Privacy equitable bonus
10. The digital divide (digital divide): How energized?
11. Electronic Public Participation (a): Internet media and social media
12. Electronic Public Participation (2): deliberative democracy may
13. Electronic Public Participation (c): The Government convince the public and policy marketing
14. The Government Performance link, enabling participation and responsibility between classes
15. governance
16. The Government of the Future 3.0
17. Group Report (a)
18. The group reports (two)"
content.ch:
"週次 課程進度與內容
1.政府服務電子化趨勢（一）：全球趨勢
2.政府服務電子化趨勢（二）：電子化政府
3.政府服務電子化趨勢（三）：電子治理
4.服務創新：智慧城市(smart city)的推動
5.雲端應用服務(app)與政府效能
6.開放資料(open data)：資訊公開與揭露
7.巨量資料(big data)：行政資料探勘
8.績效資訊與政府的績效管理
9.資料加值與個人隱私的衡平
10.數位落差(digital divide)：如何賦能？
11.電子公眾參與（一）：網路輿論與社群媒體
12.電子公眾參與（二）：審議民主的可能
13.電子公眾參與（三）：政府公眾說服與政策行銷
14.政府績效、賦能、參與及課責間的連結
15.治理能力
16.政府3.0的未來
17.分組報告（一）
18.分組報告（二）"

grading.en: "This course is taught based, supplemented by classroom discussion. Course requirements are as follows :( a) read the assigned chapters a week; (b) group work: Students with four (principles) as a group, choose a theme fourth ten weeks of cooperation to complete a brief report on classroom reports; (iii) a variety of theoretical concepts in class to teach him, or write an academic report on the basis of group work on the end of the semester to pay."
grading.ch: 本課程以講授為主，課堂討論為輔。課程要求如下：（一）每週閱讀指定章節； （二）分組作業：同學以四人（原則）為一組，選擇第四至十三週的一項主題，合作完成一份簡要報告，於課堂中報告；（三）以課堂所授之各種理論概念，或在分組作業的基礎上撰寫一篇學術性報告，在學期末繳交。
